title: (x) VOICE FARM - DIN 17m {Stephen}
content:
from sleeve cover   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214605im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/21494.jpg)

 [‹ Oldstyle monoline serif "Victorville"](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214605/http:/typophile.com/node/9496 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Design Exchange | Universal design - Aaux Pro {Marc O} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214605/http:/typophile.com/node/9558 "Go to next forum topic")
author: andrewburgess

comments.content:
Could be DIN 16 and 17. Berthold used to sell them, but I   
can't find them anymore.

I think Grant mentioned he had a Letraset catalog sporting   
these DINs, maybe he can show us a scan.

\>_I think Grant mentioned he had a Letraset catalog_   
\>_sporting these DINs, maybe he can show us a scan._   
   
Indeed.   
   
DIN 16m/17m/17 from the 1985 Letraset Product Manual (Canadian Edition)   
   
 ![DIN 16/17 from c. 1985 Letraset catalog](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214605im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/21505.gif)

Ahh, on demand - thanks Grant. I haven't seen the 'm'   
extensions on the names. That last bold one looks like   
another DIN I neglected to mention from Mecanorma   
called Normalise DIN.

Yeah, what about those Mecanorma fonts? We used to sell   
them at FontShop but I haven't found them online yet. (And   
neither have I the Mannesman Scangraphic fonts). Anybody   
knows where they can be found for online sampling?

Yves, I've come across a few Mecanorma fonts on the   
Agfa-Monotype website, but it's just been by chance   
(searching for something else) and Fonts.com offers   
no way, really, to do a search for Mecanorma fonts in   
general (i.e., searching under MN or Mecanorma won't   
work).   
   
I did find [an entry](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214605/http:/www.agfamonotype.com/about/legal.asp) in the copyrights/trademarks, though.   
 Check about 2/3 of the way down the page.   
   
MN Normalise DIN is one of several fonts that are listed   
there, but not actually offered for sale.   
   
According to [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214605/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/mecanorma/) MyFonts page, Monotype licensed and   
digitized some Mecanorma typefaces, which explains   
their listing on the Fonts.com site. Anyone know the Trip   
Productions/Mecanorma status today?
